DESC.PARA: A convolution model to calculate the luminosity of other model components.
The Sherpa commands calc_energy_flux, calc_photon_flux, and sample_flux, as well as the Calculating Model Flux and Flux Uncertainty thread can also be used.

ROW.DATA: Minimum energy over which luminosity is calculated (keV)
Maximum energy over which luminosity is calculated (keV)

DESC.PARA: Please see ahelp xsconvolve for information on how to load the model.

LIST.CAPTION: Notes
LIST.ITEM: This is an experimental release of the convolution models; please take care when using this model.
When clumin is used with multiple additive models, the normalization of one of the additive models must be fixed to a non-zero value.
The energy range defined by the Emin and Emax parameters must lie inside the energy range of the response matrix.
If the model to which clumin is applied integrates to zero then a divide-by-zero error will occur and the fit will likely fail due to the presence of NaN values.

DESC.PARA: This information is taken from the XSpec User's Guide. Version 12.9.1n of the XSpec models is supplied with CIAO 4.10.
If the power-law or gaussian normalization is fixed to a non-zero value then the above will calculate the luminosity and error on the entire model (absorbed).
If the power-law or gaussian normalization is fixed to a non-zero value then this calculates the unabsorbed luminosity and error.
If the gaussian normalization is fixed to a non-zero value then this calculates the unabsorbed luminosity and error of the gaussian component.
